item.title: My Favourite Tools
item.description: The market is flooded with great tooling, so I wanted to list a few of my favourites that I’ve used in the past. Vale Vale is a linting tool for documentation. Stick it in CI pipeline to check for markdown (or whatever flavour documentation you use), tweak your requirements with styles, and set it to fail on poor grammar. asciinema asciinema live records your terminal session and then uploads somewhere providing you with a link to share.

item.title: Using Hugo for My Blog
item.description: I recently decided to update my blog. I had brielfy touched Hugo before and I have used it again. It really is a wonderful tool for content. After almost 4 years at GDS, I’m moving on to FutureLearn. This blog signals the start of this new chapter in my career.
